name: Async-First Communication
description: No required synchronous meetings or real-time dependencies. Work should be completable without waiting for others to be online.
principle: We prefer to communicate in public channels over private ones. Transparent communication leads to increased learning and belonging.
violationExamples: Schedule a call to discuss requirements
Wait for team standup to get approval
Ping me when you're ready to sync
Let's hop on a quick call
Block time on my calendar to review
compliantExamples: Document decision in this spec and notify via async channel
Record a Loom walkthrough for complex explanations
Leave comments with questions—I'll respond within 24 hours
Review the PR asynchronously and approve when ready

name: Search-First Culture
description: Information should be findable via search, not asked for. Build systems that make knowledge accessible to all.
principle: We search before we ask. We build systems that make information accessible.
violationExamples: DM the team lead for the API docs
Ask John—he knows how this works
Check with the person who built it
I'll explain it to you in person
compliantExamples: Documentation is in /docs/api-reference
Search 'authentication flow' in Notion
The README covers this in the Setup section
Added inline comments explaining the logic

name: Manager of One
description: Specs should enable autonomy, not require hand-holding. Each person sets their own schedule and accountability.
principle: We value agency and autonomy. You set your own schedule, create your own accountability systems, and embrace a growth mindset.
violationExamples: Check with manager before each step
Get approval before proceeding
Wait for sign-off at each milestone
Report daily progress updates
compliantExamples: Make the call based on the documented criteria
Use your judgment for edge cases not covered here
Escalate only if blocked for >24 hours
Share outcome when complete

name: Centralized Knowledge
description: Single source of truth. If it's not documented, it doesn't exist. All decisions and context should live in one findable place.
principle: A single source of truth. If it's not documented, it doesn't exist.
violationExamples: Refer to the Slack thread from last week
It's in my local notes somewhere
We discussed this in the meeting
Check the email chain
compliantExamples: Decision documented in the project spec
Context added to the ticket description
Runbook updated with new steps
Added to the central knowledge base

name: Transparent Workflows
description: Work is visible to all, no silos. Project management is transparent. Anyone can see progress and context.
principle: Project management is visible to all. No work happens in silos.
violationExamples: This is just between us
Keep this in private channel
Don't share this with the team yet
I'll handle it offline
compliantExamples: Moved discussion to public channel
Updated the project board with status
All context is in the ticket
Anyone can view the progress here
